Reviews.Title: Extensive Review By Photography Newbie
Reviews.Author: Alan Montgomery
Reviews.Content: This review is aimed at people who are new to photography, as I am in the same boat.  There are much more thorough reviews on Amazon for people who are already serious photographers.General Impression:Wonderful camera - gives you control of parameters (such as f/stop, ISO, shutter speed) when you want to play with them or get creative and will auto-select them when you just want to take pictures.  This was important to me as I am still learning to adjust them to my liking but don't want to miss out on pictures because I'm fumbling around with buttons.Construction/Feel:After going to Best Buy to physically hold the Canon T3i and Nikon d5100, I immediately decided on the Nikon.  It felt much better in my hands and just looked better in general.  Both were fairly light which is nice but also means they are made from quite a bit of plastic - not a problem though as this keeps the price down and I don't drop things.Controls:I have been pleased with the placement of the physical buttons on the camera as well as the menus.  I mainly shoot in the A, S, and M modes and the little wheel you turn to adjust the shutter speed/aperture is right where your thumb falls.  If you're in M mode, there is an aperture button to hold down just behind the shutter button which is also easy to reach with the camera up to your eye.  Lastly, the Fn button can be programmed to control the ISO level so you can hold it down while spinning the wheel to change that without putting the camera down.  I have heard people complain that the Live View switch is annoying to get to but have found it intuitive.There are a few controls that I wish were changeable without having to dig through a menu though.  For instance, to change the focus mode from area to single point requires you to have the LCD screen turned around, then press the I button, then scroll around to change it.  This is the case for a few other things like metering, shutter mode, etc.  I can't really complain, though, because those are features that go on a serious photographer's camera that costs about twice as much as this model.Auto Focus:The 11-point AF on this camera has been a dream to use.  I almost always keep the camera set to single point servo autofocus so I can select the point I want it to focus to.  As long as you have some contrast, it is very quick and accurate to focus.  This camera does not have a build in focus motor which means the lens must have it built in.  As a result, older lenses or those build for the professional Nikons may not allow for autofocus.  This hasn't been a big issues as most of the lenses I would want already have the motor built in, and if they don't, people survived for a long time manually focusing - it probably builds character.  I was torn between getting the Nikon 10-24mm f/3.5-4.5G ED AF-S DX Nikkor Wide-Angle Zoom Lens for Nikon Digital SLR Camerasand Tokina AT-X116PRDXN AT-X PRO DX 11-16mm Ultra-wide Angle Lens for Nikonand ended up sticking with the Tokina even though it would not autofocus on this camera.  I haven't had any issues with focusing manually with it as the ultra-wide angles are easy to focus anyway.Noise:A lot of the reviews I read before purchasing this camera talked about how well it shot in low light - I would have to agree.  Looking at pictures from my old point and shoot at ISO 800 have horrible noise while I can shoot this at 1600 without any, and can go up to 3200 with only minimal touch ups in Lightroom needed.  This has to be the single biggest advantage of digital over film - being able to change ISO on the fly and still being able to get great pictures at ISO 3200 is wonderful.Image Quality:I won't offer too many opinions in this section, but I have not seen anything but great quality in the RAW pictures I've taken.  Basically I understand that if a picture doesn't come out right, the fault lies with me and not the camera.  The camera is capable of much better pictures than I am capable of taking.  When I do everything right (which is becoming a little more frequent) I am amazed of the result.  Great colors, great contrast, low noise, etc.Battery Life:I purchased an extra battery before I went on a few business trips just in case, but ended up never being close to needing it.  The battery just lasts and lasts and never seems to drain.  For instance, last weekend I took 381 shots (some using live view) and the battery meter was still at 75%.  No complaints in this department.Flash:The built in flash is pretty puny, which seems to be par for the course.  It does provide some nice fill lighting if you're outside taking pictures where there are some shadows on your subject, but for shooting inside it's marginal at best.  I bought the very reasonably priced Nikon SB-400 AF Speedlight Flash for Nikon Digital SLR Cameras and have been very pleased with the combo.  The external flash adds the ability to bounce light off the ceiling and not waste the camera battery while doing so. This camera does not have the Nikon flash commander ability, but I don't think that should be expected in a camera at this price point.  If I ever start buying 3 remote flashes for studio shooting, there is a good chance I will have already upgraded cameras.I'll end by saying that this has been an absolutely wonderful camera to learn to shoot on.  Before I purchased it or started shooting, I ordered and read two books,Complete Digital Photography, 6th EditionThe Digital Photography Book, Volume 1 so I would have some clue what I wanted in a camera.  They are both wonderful books and should be required reading for all new photographers.As a disclaimer: up till 3 months ago I was never in to photography, never owned an SLR and never had any real interest to.  So know that everything I say in this review is based on very little experience.

Reviews.Title: Comes with a lot
Reviews.Author: Summer D. Wood "amazon fanatic"
Reviews.Content: I'm completely an amature when it comes to photography but I think this set is pretty awesome. The two different lenses are great. There are a couple things about the camera itself I'd change, but that is more of a didn't know exactly what I was looking for not product problems.I like all the accessories this comes with, and it actually came with more than I realized I was getting.I recommend it for the price if you are looking for a good starter kit like me.

Reviews.Title: Great kit...speacially Nikon D5100 (from Santiago/Chile - Lima/Perú)
Reviews.Author: Mauricio Rodriguez Campos
Reviews.Content: Great camera Nikon D5100...is part of what I expected for the brand.It would have been better a lens with an aperture of f2.8 but obviously the kit would be more expensive.To start with is fine with your 55-300mm lens.The accessories in the kit are useful.In few words I recommend this kit.

Reviews.Title: Very complete kit for a new amateur  photographer
Reviews.Author: AlexSP
Reviews.Content: I am new to the DSLR world, and I just began taking some classes only a few days after getting the kit. I can honestly say that aside from the quality of the camera (excellent by the way... Did a lot of online research) the kit comes with enough things to get you started. I already feel ahead of the class each time the professor recommends buying something that I already own, like filters, cleaning kits or tripods.One thing though, the bag is an original Nikon, but I found it to be too small to carry both lenses and other equipment. I ended up buying a Lowepro Slingshot, which I found to be very comfortable, light, and roomy.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Digital SLR camera!
Reviews.Author: D. Williams
Reviews.Content: I'm an amateur when it comes to photography, so I wanted a good starter kit and this included everything I was looking for. You get a great deal for the price, I really couldn't ask for more. The D5100 does NOT have a depth of field preview, but that's not a very important feature for me. If it is for you, than you may want to consider getting a Canon. I'm very pleased with the camera so far, and even used it to record some fireworks in HD for the 4th of July. I hooked up the camera to my big screen TV and the quality was amazing. I'm very impressed with everything you get in this kit, and recommend it for anyone, from beginner to professional.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D5100 - Excellent, but could be better!
Reviews.Author: garry g luke
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera, but so darn intricate, that it will take some time to learn all the features. Like lesser, expensive Nikons, I'd like to see regular AA batteries be used. I have yet to learn all the features.What I DON'T like is when you press the shutter, if it doesn't like your shot, it won't shoot. I've missed a few night shots that I like shooting with existing light. There must be a way, but if you are in a hurry and don't have the time to make adjustments so the camera takes the picture you want, you are screwed!I haven't yet shot the video, but I like the fact that Nikon finally added the option. There are a lot of features I have yet to learn.I'm a Nikon fan for sure, having happily migrated from Minolta.

Reviews.Title: Product
Reviews.Author: Julian
Reviews.Content: Hi!I have recived the camera and its amazing! The quality, lenses, everything!!Everything was the same as in the reference picture.Recomend this product and then seller.Thank you.

Reviews.Title: A lot to learn
Reviews.Author: slammers47
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR camera and I can say I've got a lot to learn.  I've been trying to use manual mode to get used to all of the features and settings available.  It takes very color rich photos and the quality is better than I have used before.  I'm very satified with the camera purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great feel, Intuitive
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: Love the Camera great feel and for me it's intuitive to use. I seem to be able to remember what does what unlike other cameras I have used. The lenses are very useful for a full range of photos however I did purchase a 55mm F1.4 for lower light applications. I use the "sport mode" for taking pictures of my daughter's sports. Its shutter delay is minimal and it takes multiple pictures fast enough to catch the moment almost every time.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D5100 review
Reviews.Author: Gloria P Hansen
Reviews.Content: The camera was a gift for my niece who's studying graphic design. She absolutely loves it. The features are easy to use and it takes amazing pictures.

Reviews.Title: great delivery- would order again!
Reviews.Author: researchguru
Reviews.Content: the camera is exactly what my  husband wanted for his birthday. the company delivered in a timely manner, and all parts were as promised. I saved lots ordering this way, as I was going to purchase from Wolf camera- this was a great deal!!! highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be happier, Great deal
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: As a beginner to DSLR photography, I wanted a camera that gave me the control that my point-and-shoot did not give. This bundle gives you everything you need to get started. The camera itself has features I didn't dream of (mostly because I'm new to this, anyway). If the 2 lenses, the tripod, remote and cleaning kit don't convince you, get this bundle simply because of the 32 GB card. You're definitely going to be glad you have so much space.My only recommendation is to get a guide book for this camera. I'm using "Nikon D5100: From Snapshots to Great Shots" by Rob Sylvan. Absolutely everything is explained in this book, with step-by-step instructions to navigate through the menus. Photography jargon, background theory in very simple language and photo examples are all laid out for all topics.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D5100 rocks!!!!
Reviews.Author: dreamer_2000
Reviews.Content: Nikon D5100 is a nice DSLR within $1000 range, in this package kit we get lot of stuff, mostly they are made of cheap plastic and of low cost, but i thought it would be OK to start with and buy specific things when reqd at later point of time. Overall the camera and Nikon 55-300mm lens are awesome

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera at an amazing price
Reviews.Author: M. Evans
Reviews.Content: I searched for a while for a decent priced SLR and this kit was perfect! When purchased separately it would have cost a few hundred more. Absolutely love the camera- and the seller was Awesome! had a small issue with one of the pieces (not the camera) and seller had it to me within 2 days! Everything is included in this to get you started right down to the tripod and wireless shutter release.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Edisson Zuleta
Reviews.Content: The kit was complet, I had a little problem with the cam but the attention was personalized and excellent and the product was replaced with out problems. I should said that i'm from Colombia.

Reviews.Title: Excellent.
Reviews.Author: Vic DiCenzo
Reviews.Content: The product was exactly as described and the shipping was fast. Excellent seller and I would recommend them to others.The camera seems to be an excellent digital SLR and after much research I am glad I chose it.

Reviews.Title: great package.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: decided to go with Nikkon and this is a great package option.  recommend for others getting started - - -

Reviews.Title: Nikon d5100
Reviews.Author: Richard Cacioppo
Reviews.Content: Great Camera for novice or seasoned ammature. Camara is bag ok if you only have two lenses'. Tripod not that good.

Reviews.Title: Excellent.
Reviews.Author: Eduardo
Reviews.Content: Excellent product, all parts that come together have a very good quality. I'm very happy with the purchase. I recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Rob Burgess "Burgi3"
Reviews.Content: I haven't owned it very long and I still need to learn as this is my first foray into SLR cameras.  My first few experiences are very good.  Picture clarity is wonderful.  The automatic setting are great for a novice like me.

Reviews.Title: 1st time user
Reviews.Author: ErinPope
Reviews.Content: So far we love our camera.  We loved everything that came in the bundle.  There is so much there and I am so glad that I don't have to go out & buy it all individually.  It was a great deal!!  We are still in the process of learning.  There is a lot to take in but we have been playing with the camera a lot, trying new things & have yet to open the manual.

Reviews.Title: Love. Love. Love.
Reviews.Author: L. Pitassi
Reviews.Content: Although I mainly shoot in fully automatic (I'm learning manual in baby steps) I love this camera.  It does all the work for you.  I've been shocked at the detail it picks up even with the kit lens.

Reviews.Title: NIKON D5100 16.2 MP DIGITAL SLR  CAMERA &18-55MM
Reviews.Author: GREGORY   CHASE
Reviews.Content: MY SISTER BOUGHT THIS CAMERA FOR HER SON TO TAKE PHOTOGRAPHY IN SCHOOL AND THE PRICE OF THE CAMERA WAS EXCELLENT  PLUS THE CARRYING CASE YOU CANT BEAT THE PRICE OF THE PACKAGE SO KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK FROM GTC&ASSOCIATES.INC.HAPPY; NEW YEAR AND ALL THE BEST IN 2013

Reviews.Title: Great bundle! Except...
Reviews.Author: HappyCustomer
Reviews.Content: I'm relatively new to photography so buying an SLR was a big deal. The D5100 offers so much and that alone is really worth it. What I would not suggest is getting the telephoto lens 55-300 mm unless you absolutely need it or know that you want it. I did not do enough research and it turned out to be a relatively useless lens for portraits and things indoors, which are mostly my kind of photography subjects. So, I would say just buy a camera with the body only and then get some prime lenses if you're into portraits and "people photography". Those are much better! Nevertheless? Great bundle for beginners!

Reviews.Title: Nice Bundle!!!
Reviews.Author: J. Steven Barrett "stvbarr"
Reviews.Content: I generally do not order bundles because you wind up getting a lot of sub-standard items and to be honest, things you just don't really want.  When I researched out the main items here Camera/Kit Lens/55-300 Lens, it was a pretty good deal with just that so I opted for the bundle.I've had this for about three weeks now and the d5100 has exceeded my expectations, it is a wonderful camera and I am turning the wife into a photographer's widow.  I am still exploring the myriad of choices and learning the camera itself. I generally shoot in manual (35mm Minolta XG-7 film camera with a lot of goodies) but I have to say the presets work as advertised and if you don't like the outcome you can tweak them to get something more to your liking.  The lenses' Auto Focus and Vibration Reduction work really well and you can tweak that in many ways as well as turning them off.  I think this is really way more than an entry level dslr.  Amazing stuff.The tripod is a little bit lower end, no surprise there but is still quite nice.  This will probably live out its life as a remote flash tripod.  The Canon camera bag is a nice item though you will outgrow the size if you add much of anything.  The lenses and camera take up most of the space and a speedlight will just about max it out for the larger items.  It is a nice bag to have if you are just running somewhere to take a few candids at a family gathering or something like that.  I purchased Amazon's backpack case, VERY nice, cant beat it for 30 bucks.  I'll probably review that too.  The rest of the gear fills out the camera's capabilities nicely, remote shutter release, lens filters, cleaning kit, etc.  The SD card seems to be first rate, I've had no issues with wait times for the camera to write images with this class 10 chip.Overall, I would recommend this kit highly if you are entering the dslr arena for the first time, it gives you a nice group of equipment to begin with in this realm.  If you already have equipment, you might consider a body only but I still think the lens selection along with the camera body is a winner!

Reviews.Title: The package is good
Reviews.Author: adcitlali
Reviews.Content: The pack is good. Of course the extra items are not the absolute best quality, but they are OK. If you buy this, do it as long as it gives you a good deal for the camera and the lens. The extras can always be better. The remote control is really handy and the camera bag is good as an initial one. It is better than 2010's Nikon bag.Anyway, I got this pack as a present for a new motivated, soon-to-be amateur photographer. I think it is ideal for initiation as long as the person is truly motivated (otherwise, just get them a point and shoot camera). Once that the person starts getting the grips of the camera and photography, they can start upgrading the camera bag for something that fits their specific needs (I usually recommend Lowepro for camera bags), a new set of high quality filters, a faster memory card, etc.The only item that I would add to this pack for a starter is the lens-pen, a truly useful cleaning item.

Reviews.Title: Seems to be great but ask again in 10 years, 2 weeks is not much of a discovery period
Reviews.Author: Clovis Cal. dog owner
Reviews.Content: My first Nikon I purchased in 1968, it is still working but film has become the problem. The Camera is a Nikon, always good quality the lenses are not made in Japan, all is made from plastic, which seems to be OK as it looks like engineering grade not toy grade.  The tripod is too light and is for sure toy grade, the blower bulb is from China and just simply stinks I have had it outside for 3 weeks now and I still smell it from 5 feet away.  The case is good but the dividers use a velcro like system that could be improved on.

Reviews.Title: Awesome photos
Reviews.Author: Manuel
Reviews.Content: I am a beginer but this camera is farly the best I ever had. using the Scene mode you don't need to be an expert. I'll buy an external flash as sonn as possible

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Greg in Baton Rouge
Reviews.Content: I had watched this item on various web sites, had seen the reviews and knew I wanted it.  I bought it as a Mothers Day gift for my wife.  To be honest, she did not open it for two weeks, as the idea of using the interchangeable lenses intimidated her a bit I think.  Once she took the plunge, she was hooked.  10 minutes out of the box you are taking pictures like a pro.
